summary: The 'No Budget, No Pay Act' (HR 5755) mandates that members of Congress will not receive pay if a concurrent resolution on the budget and the regular appropriations bills for a given fiscal year are not approved by October 1st of that year. It outlines the process for determining non-payment and specifies that pay will be withheld until both the budget resolution and appropriations bills are passed. The bill takes effect February 1, 2027.
